name: Stop filling the array at the 8th element
instruction:
Write a function `stopAt8Element` that takes 3 parameters - an empty array, a start number and an end number.

The array will be filled with numbers from the initial value to the final value inclusive.

The start value is the number at which the array will start to be filled.

The final value is the number that ends the array.

The starting value will always be smaller than the ending value.

Filling of the array is interrupted at the 8th element.

The function must return the filled array.

An example of running the function:
```javascript
stopAt8Element([], 1, 30); // [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8]
stopAt8Element([], -3, 25); // [-3, -2, -1, 0, 1, 2, 3, 4]
stopAt8Element([], 5, 9); // [5, 6, 7, 8, 9]
```
